text: ğŸ“° Tech News Snippet #1452  NVIDIA Corp.â€™s stock has been on a remarkable upward trajectory, creating significant ramifications for CEO Jensen Huangâ€™s charitable foundation.  As NVIDIAâ€™s share prices soar, the foundation faces a unique challenge related to its financial giving obligations.  NVIDIAâ€™s stock surge has substantially increased the value of the foundation's holdings.  This rising value necessitates a doubling in its charitable contributions to align with regulatory requirements.  This situation highlights an intriguing intersection between corporate success and philanthropy.  The NVIDIA Foundation will need to strategize effectively to meet its enhanced giving targets while supporting impactful causes.  Jensen Huang, known for his strategic vision, will undoubtedly steer toward solutions that balance continued success for NVIDIA and meaningful societal impact.  As we watch this unfold, itâ€™s a potent reminder of the complexities linking business success, stock performance, and charitable responsibilities.  Stay tuned to see how NVIDIAâ€™s strategic moves will influence both market trends and philanthropic endeavors.

position: Co-Founder @ Bidvise | Building software for auction houses
text: CoreWeave is aiming for a valuation of over $35 billion in its U.S. IPO planned for 2025.  The New Jersey-based AI cloud platform plans to raise more than $3 billion from its share sale, possibly launching in the second quarter of 2025, depending on market conditions.  CoreWeave provides access to such infrastructure, primarily using Nvidia chips, and competes with major cloud services like Microsoft's Azure and Amazon's AWS.  The company recently completed a $650 million secondary share sale, valuing it at $23 billion, with investments from firms likeand.  Read more:

name: Helen CY Kan
position: Seasoned Banker / Board Director/ Fintech/ Consumer Bank/ Private Bank/ SME/ Wealth Mgt/ Education/ President HKWPEA/ All- China Womenâ€™s Federation / Culture& Drama
text: HKUST Honorary Doctorate Awardee Jensen Huang delivered an inspirational message today in HK today.  He was awarded as HKUST Honorary Doctorate in Engineering .  â€œThe world is reset â€œ he remarked. Nvidia reinvented computing. We are in a new Industrial Revolution. AI, machine learning and data science meant we have these new instruments to create new industries, create new solutions in virtually every field, from climate science to health science and physical science â€¦.AI is integrated into physics , biology , arts .   The fireside chat between HKUST Council Chairman Prof Harry Shum and Jensen on â€œ Technology , Leadership and Entrepreneushipâ€ was most uplifting and inspirational.  Jensen believes GBA possesses unique advantages of the R& D flywheel with high volumes mainly in three areas : cars, drones and human robots .  He furthered remarked that the opportunity of a third medical school that HKUST is submitting its application for can create a new hospital model where the domain expertise is AI and technology and not just adding AI to a traditional hospital model.  On leadership , his core message was leaders need confidence and strength, yet cannot know all and be all. Embrace uncertainties and learn every day. Be transparent , synthesize team ideas and align with clear vision and purpose.  Huang      development

text: https://lnkd.in/gPQGhtHX U.S. stocks were higher after the close on Friday, as gains in the Consumer Goods, Financials and Industrials sectors led shares higher. At the close in NYSE, the Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 0.97% to hit a new all time high, while the S&P 500 index gained 0.35%, and the NASDAQ Composite index added 0.15%. The best performers of the session on the Dow Jones Industrial Average were Boeing Co (NYSE:BA), which rose 4.10% or 5.88 points to trade at 149.29 at the close. Meanwhile, Nike Inc (NYSE:NKE) added 3.06% or 2.30 points to end at 77.40 and American Express Company (NYSE:AXP) was up 2.83% or 8.30 points to 301.30 in late trade. The worst performers of the session were NVIDIA Corporation (NASDAQ:NVDA), which fell 3.27% or 4.79 points to trade at 141.88 at the close. Unitedhealth Group (NYSE:UNH) declined 1.12% or 6.71 points to end at 590.78 and Merck & Company Inc (NYSE:MRK) was down 0.68% or 0.68 points to 99.18. name: Karan Chauhan
text: ğŸš€ Witnessing the Future of Tech at Microsoft Ignite 2024! ğŸš€  Attending as a digital participant was an eye-opening experience, showcasing how AI and cloud technologies are transforming industries. Each day brought unique perspectives and cutting-edge innovations. Here are my top highlights:  Day 1: ğŸ’¡â€™s keynote set the tone for the event, introducing Copilot and the power of AI agents. ğŸŒ Inspiring case studies from AT&T anddemonstrated AI-driven decision-making for enhanced customer experiences. ğŸ“Š Explored how Azure Database for PostgreSQL is driving greater accuracy in Generative AI applications. name: AI Brief
text: NVIDIA is helping Google Quantum AI with the design of its new quantum computing devices by using simulations.  Google Quantum AI is using NVIDIA's platform and supercomputer to simulate the physics of its quantum processors. This is to help with design challenges related to "noise," which limits the number of quantum operations.  from Google Quantum AI said that scaling quantum hardware while controlling noise is necessary for developing commercially useful quantum computers.  Simulating noise in quantum hardware needs complex simulations, which are typically very expensive. By using NVIDIA's technology, Google can now run large-scale simulations more affordably.  from NVIDIA said that AI supercomputing power is important for the success of quantum computing, and Googleâ€™s use of their platform showcases this.  With NVIDIA's technology, Google can conduct detailed simulations of 40 qubit devices, which used to take a week, in just minutes.  The software for these simulations will be available to quantum hardware engineers through the CUDA-Q platform.  Read more:

name: Pascal Biese
position: Daily AI highlights for 60k+ experts ğŸ“²ğŸ¤— AI/ML Engineer
text: Transformers + Mamba = Hy(ğ˜£ğ˜³ğ˜ªğ˜¥ ğ˜®ğ˜¢)mba   Researchers from NVIDIA just released Hymba, a new family of small language models that combines the best of both worlds: attention heads and state space model (SSM) heads.  Their key contributions are:  1. Hybrid-head parallel architecture: Attention heads provide high-resolution recall, while SSM heads enable efficient context summarization. This allows Hymba to capture both fine-grained details and the bigger picture.  2. Learnable meta tokens: These special tokens are prepended to prompts and act as a learned cache, storing critical information. This alleviates the "forced-to-attend" burden on the attention mechanism, making the model more focused.  3. Cross-layer key-value sharing and partial sliding window attention: These optimizations result in a compact cache size, further boosting efficiency.  Results: Hymba-1.5B-Base outperforms all sub-2B public models and even surpasses Llama-3.2-3B with 1.32% higher average accuracy, an 11.67x cache size reduction, and 3.49x throughput.  In other words, the model delivers state-of-the-art performance in a smaller package.  The hybrid-head architecture in particular offers a promising direction for future research, demonstrating the power of hybrid architectures in achieving both accuracy and efficiency.  For more on Hymba and other AI highlights, check out this week's LLM Watch:

name: Naveen Manwani
position: Engineer at AIMonk Labs || Crafting Stable AI Products and Enhancing Software Aesthetics || Enthusiastic about Robotics and Cutting-Edge AI Developments || Sharing the Hottest Trends in Artificial Intelligence.
text: ğŸš¨Paper Alert ğŸš¨  â¡ï¸Paper Title:  WildLMA: Long Horizon Loco-MAnipulation in the Wild  ğŸŒŸFew pointers from the paper  ğŸ¯`In-the-wild' mobile manipulation aims to deploy robots in diverse real-world environments, which requires the robot to  âš“ have skills that generalize across object configurations; âš“ be capable of long-horizon task execution in diverse environments; and âš“ perform complex manipulation beyond pick-and-place.  ğŸ¯Quadruped robots with manipulators hold promise for extending the workspace and enabling robust locomotion, but existing results do not investigate such a capability.  ğŸ¯ Author of this paper proposes â€œWildLMaâ€ with three components to address these issues:  âš“ adaptation of learned low-level controller for VR-enabled whole-body teleoperation and traversability; âš“ WildLMa-Skill -- a library of generalizable visuomotor skills acquired via imitation learning or heuristics and âš“ WildLMa-Planner -- an interface of learned skills that allow LLM planners to coordinate skills for long-horizon tasks.  ğŸ¯They demonstrated the importance of high-quality training data by achieving higher grasping success rate over existing RL baselines using only tens of demonstrations.  ğŸ¯WildLMa exploits CLIP for language-conditioned imitation learning that empirically generalizes to objects unseen in training demonstrations.  ğŸ¯ Besides extensive quantitative evaluation, they qualitatively demonstrate practical robot applications, such as cleaning up trash in university hallways or outdoor terrains, operating articulated objects, and rearranging items on a bookshelf.  ğŸ¢Organization:,,  ğŸ§™Paper Authors: Ri-Zhao Qiu, Yuchen Song, Xuanbin Peng, Sai Aneesh Suryadevara, Ge Yang, Minghuan Liu, Mazeyu Ji, Chengzhe Jia, Ruihan Yang, Xueyan Zou, Xiaolong Wang  ğŸ“ Read the Full Paper here:  ğŸ—‚ï¸ Project Page:  ğŸ¥ Be sure to watch the attached Demo Video - Sound on ğŸ”ŠğŸ”Š  ğŸµ  Music by NiKneT_Art from  Find this Valuable ğŸ’ ?  â™»ï¸REPOST and teach your network something new  Follow me ğŸ‘£,, for the latest updates on Tech and AI-related news, insightful research papers, and exciting announcements.

text: Have you ever wondered how AI systems and chatbots can provide accurate, context-specific answers?  One powerful approach is RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation).  While models like ChatGPT are designed to generate responses based on patterns in training data, RAG takes it a step further by integrating external knowledge sources in real-time.  Hereâ€™s how it works: 1ï¸âƒ£ Retrieval: Fetch relevant information from a database or documents (e.g., ChromaDB). 2ï¸âƒ£ Generation: Use an LLM to craft responses based on the retrieved data.  In a recent project, I combined ChromaDB with an LLM to build a chatbot tailored for answering domain-specific questions. This approach ensures: âœ… Highly accurate responses. âœ… Relevance for specialized datasets. âœ… Real-time adaptability.  Now, Iâ€™m taking it furtherâ€”exploring evaluation metrics to measure the performance of my RAG-based chatbot. Itâ€™s a crucial step to ensure its effectiveness in real-world scenarios.  Have you experimented with RAG or similar techniques? What use cases do you think benefit most from this approach? Letâ€™s discuss in the comments!

name: Azizi Othman
position: AI & Robotics | IT Professional | Exploring the Impact of Emerging Technologies on Society & Business
text: NVIDIA Has A New AI Model That Can Create Sounds With Text Prompts  NVIDIA is a company thatâ€™s no stranger to generative AI, and probably has the most unique contribution to the field, with AI-generated NPCs for games. A lot of this includes generating voices for said non-player characters, and it looks like the company is taking the audio generative AI to the next level with a new AI model that it calls Fugatto.  As is usual, Fugatto (which stands for Foundational Generative Audio Transformer Opus 1) works by using text prompts, but you can also add in audio bases for it to work with. You can do the usual music creation based on said text prompt, or get it to add or remove instruments from a clip you provide. You can also get it to generate a voice line, and then modify it to having an angry or calm tone, for instance.  Source: Nvidia.  In the blog post, NVIDIA calls Fugatto the Swiss Army knife for sound, capable of even producing â€œsounds never heard beforeâ€. Which, while impressive, is still quite the claim. In a YouTube video, the company demos some of these generations which are perhaps unique permutations of sounds, though one can argue that they are combinations of sounds theyâ€™ve definitely heard before.  All that being said though, it certainly sounds more capable than other audio generation tools currently out there. Though it remains to be seen if itâ€™s something that anyone can get to use, as the NVIDIA omitted the mention of availability in said blog post.  (Source: NVIDIA)  The post NVIDIA Has A New AI Model That Can Create Sounds With Text Prompts appeared first on.

name: Marius Pantea
text: Navigating the world of tech investments can be a rollercoaster ride. Recently, some analysts have suggested that Nvidia's explosive growth may be slowing down. However, there's more to the story than just numbers on a chart.  Nvidia has earned its reputation as a leader in the semiconductor industry, especially with its powerful GPUs that dominate not just gaming but also burgeoning fields like artificial intelligence and data centers. While some may argue that the hype around AI has peaked, the underlying demand for high-performance computing continues to expand. Companies across various sectors are only beginning to tap into the potential of AI, meaning Nvidia is well-positioned for continued relevance.  Furthermore, Nvidia's strategic movesâ€”like its foray into the automotive sector and partnerships with cloud service providersâ€”speak to a robust long-term growth strategy. Their push into software and services adds another dimension to their revenue streams, reducing reliance on any single market.  Investing isnâ€™t just about riding the waves; itâ€™s about recognizing solid companies that adapt and evolve. Nvidiaâ€™s commitment to innovation keeps the company at the forefront of technology trends. If you're still interested in tech investments, overlooking Nvidia might mean missing out on a potential goldmine.  So, while the chatter about a slowdown may cause some investors to hesitate, Iâ€™m ready to double down on Nvidia. The potential for growth in AI, gaming, and more is simply too compelling to ignore.  Have you considered the broader implications of Nvidiaâ€™s strategy? Letâ€™s talk about it in the comments. text: Todayâ€™s volatility in Super Micro Computer and Nvidia stocks has prompted some investors to remain cautious about the tech sector. However, other stocks also offer buying potential right now, given their low valuations and future growth. Wall Streetâ€™s price targets agree with this view, suggesting that there is more upside in the coming months that investors need to consider. The tech sector has been in the spotlight lately, especially the semiconductor sector and its big news. Of all the businesses centered around the sector, two companies are getting the most attention today, for both good and bad reasons.  NVIDIA Corporation (NASDAQ: NVDA ) has been the darling of the AI and semiconductor sectors for over a year now, but the recent allegations and speculation surrounding Super Micro Computer (NASDAQ: SMCI ) have brought some positives that investors must now weigh and deal with to protect their capital in the coming quarters. With the troubles surrounding Super Micro Computer stock resolved soon, NVIDIA could be on the way out.  But if the news is not good, the stock could also fall sharply, which is why investors should have a backup plan when chasing the next wave of gains in semiconductors and AI. With that in mind, it's helpful to consider stocks like Intel (NASDAQ: INTC ) and its potential buyer, Qualcomm (NASDAQ: QCOM ). In addition, Micron Technology (NASDAQ: MU ) is also trading at a significant discount and is worth considering.

In a recent article by Barron's, the spotlight is on Palantir Technologies and three other stocks that are poised to join the AI revolution. With its focus on AI-driven technology, Palantir is perfectly positioned to capitalize on the growing demand for sophisticated data solutions across various sectors.  But Palantir isnâ€™t the only player in this space. The article also highlights three other stocks set to join the race towards AI dominance:  1. **NVIDIA** - As a leader in graphics processing units (GPUs) for AI and machine learning applications, NVIDIA remains a critical player. Their cutting-edge technology is powering numerous AI innovations, and their stock continues to reflect investor confidence in AIâ€™s future.  2. **Microsoft** - With significant investments in AI through its cloud platform and partnerships, Microsoft is leveraging its infrastructure to extend AI capabilities across various industries. Their recent AI integrations are ensuring that they remain on the cutting edge of this transformative technology.  3. **Alphabet (Google)** - Known for its emphasis on AI research, Google is continuously enhancing its capabilities through platforms like Google Cloud and its AI-driven initiatives in search and advertising. Their ongoing commitment to AI innovation makes them a key contender.  Investing in these stocks offers an opportunity to be part of a larger trend that is redefining how businesses operate and make decisions. name: Larry Johnson
position: Global Consulting Leader, AI Solutions, Media & Entertainment
text: Turns out that AI models have, indeed, trained on produced movie and TV scripts.  "I can now say with absolute confidence that many AI systems have been trained on TV and film writersâ€™ work. Not just on The Godfather and Alf, but on more than 53,000 other movies and 85,000 other TV episodes: Dialogue from all of it is included in an AI-training data set that has been used by Apple, Anthropic, Meta, Nvidia, Salesforce, Bloomberg, and other companies. I recently downloaded this data set, which I saw referenced in papers about the development of various large language models (or LLMs). It includes writing from every film nominated for Best Picture from 1950 to 2016, at least 616 episodes of The Simpsons, 170 episodes of Seinfeld, 45 episodes of Twin Peaks, and every episode of The Wire, The Sopranos, and Breaking Bad. It even includes prewritten â€œliveâ€ dialogue from Golden Globes and Academy Awards broadcasts. If a chatbot can mimic a crime-show mobster or a sitcom alienâ€”or, more pressingly, if it can piece together whole shows that might otherwise require a room of writersâ€”data like this are part of the reason why." name: BiyaPay
text: ğŸ”¥ã€November 26ã€‘Overnight important updates at a glance 1ï¸âƒ£On Monday, the three major indexes closed higher. During the session, the Dow Jones Industrial Average rose to a maximum of 44,815.67 points, and the S&P 500 Index rose to a maximum of 6,020.75 points, both hitting record intraday highs. The Russell 2000 index of small-cap stocks closed up 1.47%, and also exceeded the historical record set in 2021 during the session. Analysts believe that the market welcomed Trumpâ€™s decision to nominate Scott Bessent as Treasury Secretary. 2ï¸âƒ£Most of the "Seven Sisters of Technology" in the U.S. stock market rose, with Google A closing up 1.75%. Meta closed up 1.07%, but Nvidia closed down 4.18% to a three-week low. Tesla closed down 3.96%. UBS poured cold water and said that Tesla's surge in market value was due to "animal spirits" rather than good fundamentals. California in the United States would not consider including Tesla in the electric vehicle tax credit program. Amazon closed up 2.2% on reports that Amazon is developing a new AI chip, Trainium 2, designed to challenge Nvidia's dominance in the field of AI chips. Popular Chinese concept stocks had mixed gains and losses, with Ji Krypton closing up 4.29%, Alibaba closing up 2.95%, and Baidu closing up 2.91%. Its "Carrot Run" plans to conduct the first phase of testing in Hong Kong before the end of the year. Bilibili closed up 0.88%, Li Auto closed up 0.72%, and Pinduoduo closed up 0.62%. JD closed down 0.49%, NetEase closed down 1.21%, and NIO closed down 3.51%. On the 10th anniversary of NIO, Li Bin issued an internal letter to all employees, asking the team to focus on improving the operating efficiency of basic business units. Goldman Sachs lowered its rating to "sell" out". 3ï¸âƒ£Market conditions: Hong Kong stocks opened lower on the 26th, with the Hang Seng Index opening down 0.5% at 19,054.4 points and the Hang Seng Index down 0.74% at 4,203.90 points. Among the constituent stocks of the KCI, NetEase fell 3.14%, NIO fell 3.06%, Xpeng Motors fell 1.44%, and Xiaomi Group fell 1.41%. The large consumer sector opened higher, and some SaaS concept stocks continued their gains. Zhiyun Health rose by more than 9%, Xinyue Technology rose by 4.35%, and Yidu Technology rose by 2.66%. Spot gold fell 3.33% to US$2,625.82 per ounce. It fluctuated downward throughout the day and was in decline most of the time, with the trading range being US$2,721.41-2,615.68. COMEX gold futures fell 3.13% to US$2,627.40 per ounce. The price of West Texas Intermediate crude oil (WTI) futures for January delivery on the New York Mercantile Exchange fell $2.30, or 3.23%, to close at $68.94 a barrel.

text: â€œBeijingâ€™s top trade negotiator met the head of Nvidiaâ€™s global business operations on Monday, ahead of an expected escalation of US restrictions on Chinaâ€™s semiconductor industry, which reportedly could come as soon as this week.  Wang Shouwen, the vice commerce minister who was a key member of Chinaâ€™s trade negotiation team during Donald Trumpâ€™s first term as US president, spoke with Nvidiaâ€™s Jay Puri, an executive vice-president of worldwide field operations, according to a statement published by the ministry.  During the meeting, Wang touted the â€œbroader opportunitiesâ€ a more open China could offer to foreign enterprises, adding that the Chinese commerce ministry is willing to strengthen communication, expand collaboration and iron out differences to put US-China economic and trade ties back on track.  Beijing welcomed Nvidia to deepen its ties in the country, and is willing to listen to companiesâ€™ requests to create a better business environment, according to the statement.  Puri told Wang that Nvidia views China as an important market, where it will continue to provide quality products and efficient services, while participating in the development of Chinaâ€™s digital economy.â€

position: Aspiring AI & Python Developer | Exploring University Opportunities with a Focus on Scholarships | High School Student at Pascal English School, Larnaca
text: NVIDIA AI Unveils Fugatto: A 2.5 Billion Parameter Audio Model that Generates Music, Voice, and Sound from Text and Audio Input NVIDIA has introduced Fugatto, an AI model with 2.5 billion parameters designed for generating and manipulating music, voices, and sounds. Fugatto blends text prompts with advanced audio synthesis capabilities, making sound inputs highly flexible for creative experimentationâ€”such as changing a piano line into a human voice singing or making a trumpet produce unexpected sounds. The model supports both text and optional audio inputs, enabling it to create and manipulate sounds in ways that go beyond conventional audio generation models. This versatile approach allows for real-time experimentation, enabling artists and developers to generate new types of sounds or modify existing audio fluidly. NVIDIAâ€™s emphasis on flexibility allows Fugatto to excel at tasks involving complex compositional transformations, making it a valuable tool for artists and audio producers. A key innovation is the Composable Audio Representation Transformation (ComposableART), an inference-time technique developed to extend classifier-free guidance to compositional instructions. This enables Fugatto to combine, interpolate, or negate different audio generation instructions smoothly, opening new possibilities in sound creation. ComposableART provides a high level of control over synthesis, allowing users to navigate Fugattoâ€™s sonic palette with precision, blending different sounds and generating unique sonic phenomena.... name: Ronaldo Polo
text: Amazon wants to build its own artificial intelligence chips. The e-commerce giant, which recently expanded its partnership with AI giant Anthropic, hopes to loosen Nvidiaâ€™s grip on the market, according to Bloomberg, and is doing so by building its own chips in a Texas lab. Nvidia, which surpassed Apple to become the world's largest company in market value, dominates as the main supplier of hardware for AI chips. However, its biggest customers, including Amazon and Alphabet, "are eager to reduce their reliance on, if not replace, Nvidia chips." But experts believe that Amazon isn't likely to shift Nvidia's pole position in the near future.

name: Dr. Lawrence A. Souza, DBA, CRE, FRICS, CCIM
position: Managing Director - Commercial Institutional Investment Sales, Finance and Research at Brookwood-Starboard Commercial
text: Wall Street rebounded from last week's retreat with a nearly 2% advance over the last five days, and the benchmark S&P 500 (SP500) is now only -0.8% from its record intraday high.  It was a week marked by steady gains, geopolitical tensions arising from developments in the ongoing war between Russia and Ukraine, chip giant Nvidia's (NVDA) quarterly results, and a furious rally in bitcoin (BTC-USD) that has seen the world's largest cryptocurrency flirt with the $100K milestone.  Nvidia (NVDA) delivered quarterly revenue that nearly doubled Y/Y and data center revenue that climbed to a record ~$31B. However, the world's largest publicly listed company's current quarter revenue outlook came in lower than some of the loftiest expectations, and for investors used to an absolute blowout report that sent shares falling after hours on Wednesday. But the stock rebounded on Thursday and eventually ended higher, with analysts focusing on its exceptional numbers.  The story of the week was, no doubt, bitcoin (BTC-USD). The cryptocurrency staged what looked like an inevitable march to $100K, though that level still remains elusive at the time of writing, coming as close as ~$XXK (this bolded part has to be checked and edited as fit in the card). Bitcoin (BTC-USD) is fast cementing its place as one of the most prominent "Trump trades" following the Republican candidate's election victory. name: Channa Samynathan

text: Experience/ IoT@re:Invent is back for itâ€™s second year.  This small project I kicked off last year with seven projects and 13 people delighted 10s of thousands of attendees at re:Invent 2023. This year it has doubled to fourteen different projects with 27 people attending and supporting the program at re:Invent.  Overview  This year Experience/ IoT@re:Invent is showcasing a diverse range of cutting-edge demonstrations and hands-on experiences at re:Invent 2024, highlighting the integration of IoT, edge computing, and artificial intelligence. The program features educational sessions, interactive workshops, and real-world applications of connected edge intelligence.  Key Highlights  Educational Sessions  Retail Innovation Chalk Talk: Demonstrating frictionless store solutions using AWS IoT and computer vision Hands-on IoT Greengrass Workshop: Teaching 160+ participants to deploy AWS IoT Greengrass on Nvidia Jetson devices  Interactive Demonstrations  Â·     Embodied AI Chess: Showcasing AI-powered physical automation using Amazon Bedrock and AWS IoT Core connected robot arms Â·     Autonomous Mobile Robot (AMR): Demonstrating intelligent navigation capabilities in collaboration with Advantech and Nvidia Â·     IoT RaceTrack: Offering interactive racing experience with real-time telemetry and IoT controls with Amazon Bedrock summarization after each race Â·     Hockey Skills Challenge: Providing competitive sports analytics through IoT sensor integration and AWS IoT Core for LoRaWAN  Infrastructure & Security  Disaster Response Network: Campus-wide deployment of 15 LoRaWAN gateways covering 40 miles of Las Vegas to track 50 GPS devices anonymously as they traverse re:Invent for 5 days with real time Amazon Location Service mapping Meshtastic Communication Trial: Testing 50 Meshtastic devices from Seeed Studio for emergency response applications with AWS staff Connected Edge Intelligence Kiosks: Real-time visitor analytics using advanced computer vision, with vision models at the edge  Technology Stack  Edge Computing: Extensive utilization of Nvidia Jetson and OnLogic platforms for edge processing Cloud Services: Integration with AWS IoT Core, Greengrass, and Amazon Bedrock throughout Partner Ecosystem: Collaboration with,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,, and others  Business Impact  These demonstrations showcase practical applications of IoT and AI technologies across retail, security, sports, and emergency response sectors, highlighting AWS's leadership in Connected Edge Intelligence (CEI) solutions.  Stay tuned for daily updates on each activation between now and the start of re:Invent.

name: Francis Benistant
position: Executive Director at Technology Modeling Automation
text: hashtag #semiconductor  hashtag #technology  hashtag #engineering  hashtag #electronics  hashtag #vlsi  hashtag #chipmanufacturing  hashtag #euindustry  hashtag #legacychips  hashtag #semiconductorindustry  hashtag #techinnovation  The EU ambition to compete in advanced chip manufacturing has faced a significant setback, as industry experts now advocate for a focus on legacy semiconductor production instead. The ESIA, which includes major players like NXP, Nexperia, GlobalFoundries, and Intel, suggests that Europe should concentrate on mature chip processes rather than trying to compete with cutting-edge technology.  ## Current State of European Chip Manufacturing  European chip manufacturing has traditionally excelled in producing legacy chips using mature processes. Recent projects, such as the ESMC joint venture involving TSMC, Bosch, Siemens, and NXP, continue to focus on this area. These chips are based on older nodes that are no longer considered cutting-edge but still have significant applications.  For context, while TSMC's 28nm process was state-of-the-art in 2011, producing advanced CPUs, GPUs, and SoCs, it is now used for less complex chips. Meanwhile, companies like Apple and Nvidia have moved on to much more advanced 3-4 nanometer processes.  ## Shift in EU Chip Strategy  The ESIA has responded positively to the appointment of Henna Virkkunen as EU Commissioner-designate for the chip industry. Both the ESIA and Virkkunen advocate for emphasizing mature processes, such as 28nm, for legacy chip production. This approach aims to cater to the needs of the automotive and industrial sectors, which often rely on less advanced chip technologies.  This shift represents a return to the original intent of the EU Chips Act, which was initially conceived as a response to COVID-related supply chain issues. Over time, the act evolved to include ambitions of making Europe competitive with East Asia and the U.S. in advanced chip production. However, the dominance of non-European players like TSMC, Samsung, and Intel in cutting-edge chip manufacturing has made this goal increasingly unrealistic.  ## Implications for European Chip Industry  While focusing on legacy chip production aligns with Europe's current strengths, it also means that the continent may never achieve complete autonomy in its chip industry supply chain. Modern technologies, including software-driven vehicles, require a mix of legacy chips and advanced processors that are economical, fast, and versatile.  Despite these limitations, Europe maintains a strong position in the global chip industry through companies like Imec and ASML. This underscores the reality that the chip industry is inherently globalized, and while Europe has an important role to play, it cannot operate in isolation.  In conclusion, the EU's dream of building advanced chips has indeed faced significant challenges, leading to a more pragmatic approach focused on leveraging existing strengths in legacy chip production and maintaining a vital role in the global semiconductor value chain.

name: Pratik Chavare
text: ğ€ğ«ğ­ğ¢ğŸğ¢ğœğ¢ğšğ¥ ğˆğ§ğ­ğğ¥ğ¥ğ¢ğ ğğ§ğœğ ğ¢ğ§ ğƒğ«ğ®ğ  ğƒğ¢ğ¬ğœğ¨ğ¯ğğ«ğ²   ğƒğ¨ğ°ğ§ğ¥ğ¨ğšğ ğğƒğ… ğğ«ğ¨ğœğ¡ğ®ğ«ğ- https://lnkd.in/gMbDPAJH  Artificial Intelligence (AI) is revolutionizing the field of drug discovery, streamlining processes, and providing unprecedented insights into disease treatment and prevention. AI leverages vast datasets and sophisticated algorithms to make drug development faster, more cost-effective, and more precise.  Central to the ecosystem are governments and regulatory bodies, which provide oversight and frameworks, and academic researchers/organizations, which contribute to foundational research. Major key players such as BenevolentAI, NVIDIA, Google, and Microsoft drive innovation through advanced AI technologies and platforms, while key startups like CytoReason, Evaxion, and Predictive Oncology introduce agile, specialized solutions.  End users, including pharmaceutical and biotechnology companies, as well as contract research organizations (CROs), leverage AI tools to streamline drug discovery processes. These entities benefit from a broad array of enablers, such as cloud service providers (Microsoft Azure, AWS), hardware providers (Intel, IBM), and business intelligence tools (SAP, Oracle). This network ensures seamless data processing, advanced analytics, and secure infrastructure to support AI applications.  Together, this ecosystem accelerates drug discovery by enhancing data analysis, predicting molecular interactions, and optimizing clinical trials, ultimately reducing time-to-market for new treatments and improving success rates.

name: Nandini Maheshwari
text: Project 90: Moore Machine for even parity generator  hashtag #108rtlprojects  âœ¨ What is a Moore Machine?  A Moore machine is a subclass of FSM in which output is dependent solely on the present state. This characteristic makes it deterministic, well-suited for uses where expected functionality is of great importance.  ğŸ¯ Even Parity Generator  The idea sounds simple but is significant: the number of 1s in the succeeded binary sequence must be preserved as even; this is achieved by adding the appropriate parity bit. Hereâ€™s the Moore machine approach towards the issue:  States: Indicates if the sequence has even number or odd number of 1s.  Transitions: Event Occurrences defined by one or zero input bits.  Output: The output value is decided by the existing state making it a parity output generator.  ğŸŒŸ Applications  Generators of the parity type circuits like these are vital for the mechanisms of error detection and correction in data transfer and storage.  I am very grateful to my teammates,,,andfor their support and dedication throughout the project.  A huge thanks to,,,,,andfor their technology support in the semiconductor world ğŸŒ.

name: Aneesh Babu
position: Forex & Stock Market Analyst | Swing Trader with 5+ Years of Expertise in Financial Markets
text: In a surprising turn of events, the Dow Jones Industrial Average closed at a record high of 44,860.31, just a day after President-elect Donald Trump pledged significant tariffs on Canada, Mexico, and China. The S&P 500 and Nasdaq followed suit, also reaching record highs, rising 0.55% and 0.60%, respectively.  Trump's proposed tariffs include: - 25% on Canada and Mexico to address immigration and drug trafficking issues. - 10% on China, targeting imported products.  Despite fears of inflation and a potential trade war, the stock market shrugged off panic, with major players like Apple (+0.12%) and Nvidia (+0.66%) showing resilience. However, Tesla (-0.11%) saw a slight dip, possibly due to its Shanghai manufacturing plant.  Economists warn of the potential consequences for U.S. consumers, estimating that these tariffs could cost households an average of $2,600 per year. Yet, the strong performance of key firms helped boost market sentiment, pushing indices to new heights.

name: Deepak gupta
text: Last Monday, the first images of this new generation were leaked through Amazon through the two models that ASRock plans to launch with 2 and 3 fans respectively and where all the specs.  Yesterday it appeared in Geekbench a performance test of the Intel Arc B580 with a performance that should be taken with a grain of salt and that, at first, does not seem like a good option for the most demanding users. Intel launched the Intel Arc range two years ago at a lower than normal price compared to NVIDIA and amd and, even so, it didnâ€™t go well at all.  With the Intel Arc B580 Battlemage, the guys at Intel want to follow the same pricing strategy and according to the latest leak, it will be priced at only $250.  Price of the Intel Arc B580 Battlemage Intelâ€™s second attempt to position itself in the graphics card market dominated with an iron fist by NVIDIA and with AMD with a minimal part of the pie, seems to follow the same pricing strategy. This new generation uses Xe2-HPG architecture to improve not only performance but also efficiency and includes, of course, improved support for ray tracing. The success of the Intel Arc B580, as with any graphics card or processor, not only depends on a good pricing strategy, but also on its performance and what the drivers are capable of offering.    Intel Arc B580 Limited Edition Graphics Box31P06HB0BA735858549271$250ğŸ˜  November 27, 2024 â€¢ 13:54     Once again, the source of this information comes from the X (Twitter) user momomo_us who has published various price screenshots from various websites. But, the most curious thing of all is that, as we can see in these images, there is talk of a limited edition. With that, we donâ€™t know if it is a promotional launch version or if it is simply a commercial claim that is going nowhere. What do we know about the Intel Arc B580 The Intel Arc B580 will reach the mid-range market, it has 12 GB GDDR6 video memory and 20 Xe2 cores. This means 4 GB less memory and 4 cores than the previous generation, figures that should be compensated with the new architecture since, otherwise, it makes no sense for Intel to go down the path of efficiency instead of performance at the same time. What have you done with the new ones? Core Ultra 200 Series. Another aspect that also draws attention to this new generation of Intel graphics is that, for now, it seems that ASRock is the only manufacturer that wants to give Intel a new opportunity, at least based on the information we know so far. Regarding the release date, if we continue this pace of leaks, it is likely that tomorrow or at most Monday we will know.

text: In the fast-paced world of tech stocks, fluctuations can often catch investors off guard, and this week has been no exception. Nvidia, a leader in graphics processing units and AI technology, saw its stock fall over 10% amidst rising concerns about potential tariffs linked to ongoing discussions about trade policies.  These developments come as former President Trump has reignited conversations around tariffs, prompting uncertainty in the market. Investors are understandably concerned about how additional tariffs could impact Nvidia's supply chain and overall profitability. With an increasing reliance on international suppliers, any trade restrictions could hamper Nvidia's growth trajectory.  The tech sector has been relatively resilient over the past few years, but it's crucial for stakeholders to remain vigilant. Economic policies and geopolitical tensions can have profound impacts on high-performing stocks. Therefore, understanding the broader landscape is essential for making informed investment decisions.  For potential investors, this moment of volatility may represent either a cautionary tale or an opportunity. A dip in stock prices could be an enticing entry point for those who believe in Nvidia's long-term potential and its innovations in AI and machine learning.  As we navigate through these uncertain waters, itâ€™s essential for investors to keep an eye on corporate earnings reports and market analyses that may indicate how Nvidia plans to address these potential challenges. The company has an impressive track record, so confidence in its resilience could pay off in the long run.  In summary, while Nvidia's stock might be feeling the heat right now, understanding the causes behind this fluctuation is key. Markets are often influenced by more than just the companies themselves; external factors can shift perceptions and performance almost overnight. text: Amazon FSx for Lustre Now Delivers 12x Faster Storage Performance for GPU Workloads.. ğŸ˜ƒ   FSx for Lustre, a service designed for high-performance and scalable file storage, now supports Elastic Fabric Adapter ( ) and GPUDirect Storage (GDS). This upgrade makes FSx for Lustre the fastest storage solution for GPU instances in the cloud, offering up to 12 times higher throughput per client instance (up to 1200 Gbps). This significant performance boost helps complete machine learning training jobs faster and reduces overall costs for high-compute workloads.  EFA enhances workload performance by using the Scalable Reliable Datagram (SRD) protocol. It increases network efficiency and bypasses the operating system during data transfers, enabling higher throughput for high-performance computing (HPC) instances like Trn1 and Hpc7a.  Meanwhile, GDS takes this further by creating a direct data path between FSx for Lustre and GPU memory. This eliminates unnecessary memory copies and CPU involvement, making data transfers faster and more efficient. With EFA and GDS, applications running on powerful GPU instances, such as the NVIDIA P5 series with CUDA, can achieve significantly better performance up to 12x higher throughput per client instance.  These new features are available at no extra cost for FSx for Lustre Persistent-2 file systems in all AWS Regions where Persistent-2 is offered. To learn more, check out the Amazon FSx for Lustre documentation and the AWS News Blog...  (EFA) (GDS) cloud storage upgrades

name: Ayush Agarwal
text: ğŸŒŸProject Milestone: Advancing Patient Support with AIğŸŒŸ  Iâ€™m excited to share ongoing progress on my capstone project at NU Medicine, where I am leading the development of an AI-powered Conversation RAG Agent designed to assist patients with cancer-related questions. This project has been a rewarding journey, blending technical innovation with the impactful goal of enhancing patient care. Here are some key highlights so far:  ğŸ”¹AI-Driven Medical Insights: Spearheading the creation of a question-answering system for radiation oncology treatment, integrating LLM and Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) technologies to deliver accurate, context-aware responses. ğŸ”¹Advanced Model and Agent Integration: Implementing advanced models like LlaMA3 and ClinicalBERT along with specialized agents for task automation. This combination ensures reliable, timely responses that align with trusted medical sources, streamlining information retrieval for optimal patient support. ğŸ”¹Scalable Architecture: Designing a microservices-based backend infrastructure with LangChain and LangServe, supported by PostgreSQL and PGVector for efficient data retrieval and storage. ğŸ”¹Cloud Deployment in Progress: Deploying on AWS to ensure scalability and performance, utilizing AWS Bedrock, ECS, and RDS for an efficient cloud infrastructure.  The journey so far has been full of learning and overcoming challenges, and Iâ€™m incredibly grateful for the unwavering support of Troy Teo and the entire Capstone team (Seth Kazarian,and). Your guidance and collaboration have been invaluable in driving this project forward. Thank you all for being such inspiring partners on this journey!  Looking forward to refining this solution and contributing to more AI-driven breakthroughs in healthcare.

name: Marius Pantea
position: Founder, Business Developer, and Entrepreneur @ Consulting Intermediary Agency Ltd
text: ğŸ” Nvidia's stock has recently experienced a significant dip, falling over 10% in just one week. The catalyst? Discussions surrounding potential tariffs, primarily linked to the ongoing uncertainties in international trade, particularly influenced by former President Trumpâ€™s comments.  For a company like Nvidia, which has become synonymous with innovation in GPU technology and artificial intelligence, any talk of tariffs raises immediate concerns about supply chain costs and market competitiveness. Investors often look to Nvidia not just for its current performance, but also its future growth potential in key sectors such as gaming, data centers, and automotive technology.  The past week serves as a reminder of how external factors, including political rhetoric, can have immediate consequences on stock performance. While Nvidia is still a titan in the tech industry, fluctuations like these emphasize the importance of agility in response to market sentiment and regulatory changes.  As we navigate these waters, itâ€™s crucial for investors and industry professionals to stay informed. Will Nvidia bounce back? How will the company adjust its strategies in response to these tariff discussions?  Engaging in thorough research, understanding market dynamics, and maintaining a diversified portfolio can help mitigate risks.  Let's keep the conversation going: What are your thoughts on the impact of political discourse on tech stocks? text: ğŸš€ NVIDIA AI Unveils cuPyNumeric: Supercharging Python with GPU-Accelerated, Distributed Computing!  NVIDIA has just dropped a game-changer in the world of Python computing: cuPyNumeric â€“ an open-source library designed as a seamless, drop-in replacement for NumPy. The best part? It brings blazing GPU acceleration and cluster-scale computing to your Python code without requiring a single line of modification. ğŸ’»âš¡  Why is cuPyNumeric a Big Deal?  Traditional NumPy, while powerful, hits its limits when it comes to massive datasets or computationally heavy tasks. Enter cuPyNumeric, built on NVIDIA's RAPIDS ecosystem. This powerhouse leverages CUDA and Dask for efficient parallel execution, slashing computation times and boosting performance to jaw-dropping levels. ğŸ¯  Key Features:  ğŸ”¹ GPU-Powered Speed: Say goodbye to slow computations and hello to lightning-fast results. ğŸ”¹ Cluster-Scale Efficiency: Scale your workflows effortlessly across entire GPU clusters. ğŸŒ ğŸ”¹ Seamless Integration: Keep your Python workflows simple and familiarâ€”just like NumPy! ğŸ ğŸ”¹ Open-Source Awesomeness: Completely open-source, making it accessible to all data scientists and researchers.  Who Stands to Benefit?  From data scientists to AI researchers, anyone working with large datasets or high-performance computing will find cuPyNumeric a game-changer. Itâ€™s a giant leap forward in simplifying high-performance computing while preserving Python's intuitive workflow. ğŸŒŸ  Want to dive deeper into this revolutionary library? name: Manjushree MP
position: Conversational AI Engineer| Chatbot developer | Content Curator | Tester | Espressive
text: Thrilled to share my experience of  hashtag #NVIDIAAISummit2024. My team and I had the privilege of presenting in the final round of Nvidia Hackathon securing a spot among the top 15 teams selected to showcase our innovative idea . This remarkable experience has inspired me to continue pushing boundaries and transforming into ideas into an impactful solution. Being a part of such a prestigious platform felt surreal and I'm Grateful to NVIDIA for this amazing opportunity and to our mentor. The summit was much more than just a Hackathon. It was an immersive exploration of the future technology and expert-led session that provided invaluable insights. A stand out moment was hearing visionary perspectives from NVIDIA CEO Jensen Huang and Reliance Chairman Mukesh Ambani on India's digital transformation and AI's pivotal role in shaping it. This journey is just the beginning. Thank you to everyone who made it unforgettable.

name: Zied Tayeb, PhD
position: Founder & CEO @ Myelin-H | Associate Professor | NASA iTech Innovator
text: A cracking and brilliant article in the Financial Times today, titled â€˜Can Europe Build Its First Trillion-Dollar Start-Up?â€™    The article brilliantly lays out the challenges: â€˜There are only seven trillion-dollar tech companies in the worldâ€”Alphabet, Amazon, Apple, Meta, Microsoft, Nvidia, and Tesla. All are American. None are European. Going a level down, Europe has four $100bn-plus tech companies compared to the US's 33.â€™  The main culprits? Excessive regulation, bureaucracy, and a dormant appetite for bold bets on revolutionary tech start-ups.  DeepMind is a prime example, amongst many others. It was acquired by Google for just Â£400m and is now valued in the tens of billions of pounds.  As highlighted in the 400-page Draghi report and todayâ€™s FT article: â€˜Europe needs to celebrate and support experienced founders who are building and investing in the highest-risk, highest-reward ideas.â€™ There is an unequivocal need for bold and 'audacious' capital.  At, as a deep tech start-up, weâ€™re playing our part by pushing the envelope of brain-computer interfaces and redefining the future of brain health.  The grand takeaway? Europeâ€™s potential is undeniably immenseâ€”but has the continent finally realised itâ€™s time to stand tall?  Hats off tofor the fantastic cover story and thoughtful piece!

name: Karun Thankachan
position: Senior Data Scientist @ Walmart (ex-Amazon) | DS/ML Mentor | RecSys Researcher | Inventor
text: NVIDIA Data Science (DL Engineer) Interview Question: How do you choose between CBOW and Skip-gram architctures?  ğ——ğ—®ğ˜ğ—®ğ˜€ğ—²ğ˜ ğ—¦ğ—¶ğ˜‡ğ—² Skip-Gram performs better with smaller datasets because it creates more training examples from each input sentence. For each word, it generates multiple context-word pairs, effectively increasing the amount of training data. CBOW, by averaging context words, benefits more from larger datasets where it has enough examples to learn robust representations.  ğ—ªğ—¼ğ—¿ğ—± ğ—™ğ—¿ğ—²ğ—¾ğ˜‚ğ—²ğ—»ğ—°ğ˜† Skip-Gram handles rare words better because it treats each context-target word pair as a separate training example, giving equal importance to rare and frequent words. CBOW, by averaging context words, tends to smooth over distributional information, leading to better representations for frequent words but potentially less accurate representations for rare words.  ğ—§ğ—¿ğ—®ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—¦ğ—½ğ—²ğ—²ğ—± CBOW typically trains faster because it predicts a single target word from multiple context words in one forward pass. Skip-Gram, conversely, predicts multiple context words for each target word, requiring more computations per training example.  ğ—–ğ—¼ğ—»ğ˜ğ—²ğ˜…ğ˜ ğ—ªğ—¶ğ—»ğ—±ğ—¼ğ˜„ ğ—¦ğ—¶ğ˜‡ğ—² Skip-Gram can handle larger context windows more effectively because it directly models the relationship between each target word and its context words. CBOW, by averaging context words, may lose some of the nuanced relationships in larger contexts, making it more suitable for smaller window sizes.  ğ—¦ğ—²ğ—ºğ—®ğ—»ğ˜ğ—¶ğ—° ğ—–ğ—®ğ—½ğ˜ğ˜‚ğ—¿ğ—² Skip-Gram often captures semantic relationships better because it learns to predict each context word independently. This allows it to pick up on subtle semantic differences and relationships between words. CBOW, by averaging context, may miss some of these finer distinctions.  ğ—–ğ—¼ğ—ºğ—½ğ˜‚ğ˜ğ—®ğ˜ğ—¶ğ—¼ğ—»ğ—®ğ—¹ ğ—¥ğ—²ğ˜€ğ—¼ğ˜‚ğ—¿ğ—°ğ—²ğ˜€ CBOW generally requires fewer parameters because it averages context word vectors before prediction, resulting in a smaller model size. Skip-Gram, predicting multiple context words, needs more parameters and thus more computational resources.  ğ—–ğ—¼ğ—ºğ—ºğ—²ğ—»ğ˜ your answer below!  ğ—¥ğ—²ğ—½ğ—¼ğ˜€ğ˜ with comments to grow your own network! ğ—Ÿğ—¶ğ—¸ğ—² for more such content.  Followfor everything DS/ML  (IMG:)

name: Jeffrey Cooper
position: Technology Author, Blogger, & Consultant | ex-Sourcing Lead at ASML | ex-Director Supply Chain at ABB | ex-Finance Mgr. at GE
text: Inside Elon Muskâ€™s Quest to Beat OpenAI  The Tesla CEO is racing to make xAI, which launched after its competitors, the worldâ€™s most advanced AI company  Elon Muskâ€™s xAI is racing to catch up with AI giants like OpenAI by leveraging exclusive data from X and Tesla and building a massive infrastructure such as the Colossus data center in Memphis, which was constructed in a record 122 days using 100,000 Nvidia GPUs. Despite raising $11 billion and achieving a valuation of $50 billion, xAI faces challenges due to limited market penetration and $100 million in annual revenue compared to OpenAI's projected $4 billion. Muskâ€™s relentless pursuit of AI dominance includes aggressive hiring, partnerships, and investments; however, the competition remains fierce, with established players like Google, Meta, and Anthropic dominating the space.  My Take  Muskâ€™s xAI demonstrates the power of rapid execution. However, scaling innovation into market leadership will require more than unique data access and cutting-edge infrastructureâ€”it demands delivering a product that resonates with developers and consumers.     Link to article:   Credit: Wall Street Journal  Get Ahead with the Latest Tech Insights! Explore my blog:

name: Deniz Bekar
text: Can Europe build its first trillion-dollar start-up?, Nov 30th 2024, Financial Times  This essay byhighlights significant issue in the European tech ecosystem. It offers valuable knowledges on the business evolution of major tech companies, such as Google, Meta, Nvidia, DeepMind, and Spotify, from their startup phases. I agree with the author that access to capital is essential for start-ups, and experienced founders can do so much in this regard. Furthermore, ambitious start-ups with high growth potential have no limits as they are pioneers of the technological innovation. So, they require high-risk, long-term investments to drive breakthrough advancements. However, I believe that a comparison between the United States and Europe deserves a more nuanced analysis.  In my opinion, this is not only about regulations and lack of supporting experienced founders. The US has a vast domestic market and we attested many times that US government supports the US tech industry in order to accelerate the global market dominance. In contrast, Europe faces challenges in scaling companies due to a smaller national markets and more stringent regulations. These factors can hinder their ability to compete effectively on a global scale.

name: Eric Luteijn
position: B2B tech & ITfluencer - MD & Publisher LuteijnMedia BV
text: NVIDIA wil  hashtag #robot operators in  hashtag #datacenters - Nvidia zet een nieuwe stap in automatisering door  hashtag #robots in te zetten voor het beheer van datacenters. Het bedrijf heeft een ingediend voor een systeem genaamd ', waarmee autonome machines server racks en andere componenten kunnen beheren en bedienen |  In de patentaanvraag verklaart Nvidia dat het groeiende formaat en de toenemende complexiteit van datacenters het en van apparatuur steeds uitdagender maken voor technici.  Het voorgestelde systeem maakt gebruik van robots die server racks verplaatsen en positioneren.  Een centraal stuurt de robots aan en past de configuratie van het datacenter dynamisch aan, afhankelijk van factoren zoals vraag naar rekenkracht, onderhoudsbehoeften en omgevingsomstandigheden.  Daarnaast houdt het monitoringsysteem de koelsystemen van datacenters in real-time in de gaten en optimaliseert het deze waar nodig. Dit zou het eenvoudiger maken om datacenters te schalen en aan te passen zonder dat menselijke technici continu nodig zijn.  Verder benadrukt Nvidia dat bij problemen die robots niet kunnen oplossen, een technicus wordt gewaarschuwd via een melding of alarm om de storing handmatig te onderzoeken.  Hoewel Nvidia zich op deze manier positioneert als innovator, is het onwaarschijnlijk dat het bedrijf zelf datacenters gaat bouwen of beheren.  Het huidige bedrijfsmodel, waarbij Nvidia technologie en chips levert aan andere partijen, is immers zeer succesvol. In het meest recente kwartaal rapporteerde het bedrijf een omzet van $35,08 miljard, een stijging van 94% ten opzichte van het voorgaande jaar.  Alleen al de inkomsten uit datacenters bedroegen $30,8 miljard, een groei van 112% op jaarbasis.  Door patenten zoals deze te ontwikkelen, kan Nvidia niet alleen licentieovereenkomsten en samenwerkingen aangaan, maar ook de toekomstige richting van datacenterontwikkeling vormgeven.  Op deze manier kan het bedrijf dus invloed uitoefenen op de bredere markt zonder zelf datacenters te hoeven bouwen.  Toch roept de introductie van robots in datacenters fundamentele vragen op: hoe ver moet automatisering gaan? En is het altijd wenselijk om menselijke tussenkomst volledig te elimineren?  Als een robot een server rack efficiÃ«nter kan verplaatsen dan een mens, wat is dan eigenlijk de rol van de mens. Is die rol er nog wel? Bovendien speelt de economische vraag mee: is het daadwerkelijk goedkoper om robots in te zetten?  .. lees meer op #

name: Dr. Saju Skaria
position: Founder & CEO @ Digitech Services Inc. & Digicare Inc. | Forbes Council Member I Published Author I Keynote Speaker
text: Dr. Saju Skariaâ€™s Weekly Reflections 48/2024  Resilience, Vision, and Work Ethic: The Triad of Success!  Resilience, vision, and work ethic are the foundations of personal and professional success. NVIDIA's CEO, Jensen Huang, exemplifies how these traits, when combined, fuel extraordinary accomplishments and sustain innovation.  Resilience involves more than recovering from setbacks; it is about adapting, learning, and emerging stronger. Huang underscores this by stating, "Persistence and resilience are key to overcoming challenges and achieving success." This perspective highlights the necessity of enduring difficulties to achieve meaningful growth.  Vision provides purpose and direction, guiding efforts to overcome obstacles. Huang articulates this by asserting, "Success is a work in progress. It's not about achieving a goal; it's about constantly improving and pushing boundaries." This mindset fosters innovation and drives individuals and organizations toward excellence.  Huangâ€™s legendary work ethic has also been pivotal to his success. Known for his hands-on leadership, he actively engages in both technical and strategic aspects of NVIDIA's operations. His dedication is encapsulated in his remark, "Excellence is the result of caring deeply and working tirelessly toward a vision." Huangâ€™s relentless pursuit of excellence sets an inspiring example, motivating those around him to push their limits.  Under Huang's leadership, NVIDIA transformed from a fledgling startup in 1993 into a global leader in graphics processing units and artificial intelligence. His ability to balance vision, resilience, and work ethic allowed NVIDIA to overcome intense competition and thrive in a rapidly evolving industry. Reflecting on this journey, Huang states, "Our work is never done. This is a journey, not a destination," emphasizing the importance of continuous effort and innovation.  Moreover, Huang champions a culture that embraces challenges as opportunities. He notes, "True innovation requires taking risks and being willing to fail," demonstrating that resilience is cultivated in environments where experimentation and learning from failure are encouraged.  In conclusion, the combination of resilience, vision, and work ethic is a powerful formula for overcoming challenges and achieving sustained success. Jensen Huangâ€™s leadership at NVIDIA serves as a testament to these principles, offering a roadmap for anyone aspiring to excel. By embracing these qualities, individuals and organizations can navigate adversities, inspire others, and strive toward greatness.  Watch the short video:  Your thoughts!

name: Precious Ogunyanju
text: Elon Musk's artificial intelligence company, xAI, reportedly reached a valuation of $50 billion just 16 months after its founding in July 2023. It is now worth more than what the billionaire paid for Twitter. Arguably the most well-known name in the AI space, OpenAI, last valued at $157 billion, needed over nine years to achieve the same milestone. xAI is gaining traction in the competitive AI sector and is now valued higher than other AI startups, such as Anthropic (valued at $19 billion) and Perplexity (at $2.8 billion). xAI's journey has been marked by significant milestones, including raising $5 billion in its latest funding round to purchase 100,000 Nvidia chips. These chips will power the Memphis supercomputer, a facility designed to enhance the company's AI capabilities and support Tesla's Full Self-Driving (FSD) technology. According to WSJ and other outlets, the funding included $5 billion from Valor Equity Partners, Sequoia Capital, Andreessen Horowitz and Qatar Investment Authority. The Memphis supercomputer, awaiting final approval, is a key part of xAIâ€™s strategy. It was built in less time than is customary for projects of this kind and is situated on a former manufacturing site. In a recent podcast, Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang mentioned that xAI finished building the supercluster in 19 days, although the procedure usually takes more than a year. â€œJust to put in perspective, 100,000 GPUs are easily the fastest supercomputer on the planet as one cluster. A supercomputer that you would build would normally take three years to plan,â€ Huang said, stressing the role of xAI's engineering and infrastructure teams and crediting them with the system's rapid deployment. xAI has most notably developed the AI chatbot Grok, inspired by the sci-fi novel The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy. Grok is positioned as a competitor to OpenAI's ChatGPT, Google's Gemini and Anthropic's Claude. The chatbot uses xAI's proprietary large language model, Grok-2 and has been a notable part of the company's portfolio. Elon Musk has openly said that his social media platform, X, is being used to help train xAI's Grok chatbot. By tapping into the conversations and posts on X, the chatbot can learn to respond more naturally and relevantly. In just 16 months, xAI has achieved a notable valuation and infrastructure development within the industry. The company is preparing for further advancements with plans to double the number of AI chips at the Memphis facility.

text: A New Era for AI Training with OpenAI's o1 Model ğŸš€   AI training is evolving, and OpenAI's groundbreaking 'o1' model leads the way!  Unlike traditional scaling methods, the o1 model mimics human reasoning by breaking tasks into steps and using expert feedback.  This approach not only saves resources but also addresses challenges like skyrocketing costs and energy demands in AI model development.  ğŸ’¡ Why it Matters:  The innovative "test-time compute" technique lets AI allocate resources dynamically, boosting accuracy without excessive hardware.  For instance, a 20-second poker analysis delivered performance equivalent to scaling a model 100,000x longer!  ğŸŒ Impact on the Industry:  With players like Google DeepMind and Anthropic adopting similar strategies, competition is intensifying.  Nvidia, a key AI chip supplier, may need to adapt as AI hardware demands shift, opening doors for new competitors.  Follow ğŸ‘‰for more insights on Web3, crypto, AI, and Blockchain & consider sharing â™»ï¸ this post if you love it.  AI isn't just scaling only, it's transforming. Stay tuned for the possibilities!

text: A reminder that Google has been among the top players into the accelerated computing space (pretty much what we call today an AI supercomputing system) with its TPU which is a chip (launched internally in 2015 and to the public in 2016), similar to the GPU but optimized since the onset for machine learning tasks. Itâ€™s pretty much the AI chip which powers up all Googleâ€™s AI efforts (e.g. Gemini). The latest Googleâ€™s iteration of the TPU is the v6e Trillium which is faster and more powerful than its previous version, with double the memory (32GB) and nearly 5x better performance for AI tasks. It connects more efficiently to servers, lowering costs for businesses using it.  This helps Google compete with NVIDIA in the AI hardware space!  It has: â€¢ More Memory: Doubled memory capacity to 32GB for faster processing. â€¢ Big Performance Boost: Nearly 5x better performance for AI tasks like machine learning. â€¢ Faster Connections: Improved server connections make data transfer quicker and smoother. â€¢ Lower Costs: Faster hardware helps businesses save on overall costs. â€¢ Competitive Edge: Keeps Google in the race with NVIDIA for top AI hardware.

name: JNJ Associates LLC

text: What Moved Markets This Week  IND, DJI, DIS, BBCP, SMCI, MSTR, ZM, BLBD, BMY, NVDA, MRNA, SCHD, ULTA, ENPH, RL, CPRT, DELL, ADSK, HPQ, INTU  The words of the holiday-shortened week on Wall Street were "tariffs" and "inflation." Despite some concerns around the two, U.S. equities eventually logged their second straight weekly gain, with the benchmark S&P 500 (SP500) ending at a record close.  Market participants got a taste of what is to come under Donald Trump's second administration, after the President-elect said he would levy 25% tariffs on goods coming from Mexico and Canada. He'll also look to charge an additional 10% tax on products from China, which would be above any additional tariffs.  A day before the Thanksgiving holiday, traders received a flurry of economic data. That included an unrevised updated estimate on U.S. Q3 GDP growth of 2.8%, and October's reading on the core personal consumption expenditures price index - widely seen as the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation gauge. The data came in slightly hot, and showed that the Fed isn't out of the woods yet when it came to inflation.  The Fed's minutes of its November monetary policy committee meeting showed policymakers discussing the possibility of pausing rate cuts if inflation remains too elevated.  For the week, the S&P (SP500) climbed +1.1%, while the Nasdaq Composite (COMP:IND) also added +1.1%. The Dow (DJI) gained +1.4%.    Concrete Pumping (BBCP) Shares Are Too Cheap To Ignore. name: Marco FÃ¶rster
text: Vietnam was sad that Indonesia got the NVIDIA deal. Indonesia felt the same when VN got all that Apple investment. Plot twist: Now NVIDIA will go to VN, and Apple will go to ID. I coin it the Great Southeast Asian Tech Shuffle  In the high-stakes race for tech FDI, VN and ID are rewriting the playbook. Just as VN cemented its partnership with Apple to manufacture flagship products, ID secured a massive win with NVIDIA's plans for a regional AI data center earlier this year.  It seemed each nation had one-upped the otherâ€”until now. Apple has announced plans to invest $100 million in its first manufacturing plant in ID, aiming to comply with local content requirements and solidify its presence in SEA's largest economy.  Meanwhile, NVIDIA is set to (finally, after a lot of courting) open an AI research center in VN, tapping into the country's tech-savvy workforce and deepening its footprint in the region.  These moves highlight a broader strategy of diversification as global tech giants shift supply chains to multiple ASEAN countries. This comes in record speed, also in light of Trump 2.0.  The competition is fierce, but the ultimate winners might just be the people of both nations, benefiting from cutting-edge technologies and job creation.  This dynamic could redefine regional trade and cooperation. Both countries appear committed to leveraging their unique strengths while welcoming global investments.

name: Dwarakanath Srinivasan
position: Release Manager at Motorola Mobile Devices
text: Quite Interesting. The article implies that Taiwan Semiconductor is ready to roll out chips from its Chandler Arizona plant. If that is the case, it also leads one to conclude that Intel is falling behind in execution to realize its strategy. Both Taiwan Semi and Intel started to build their plants just around the same time and looks like Taiwan Semi is ahead. That could possibly explain why Intel's CEO quit. Given that chip fabrication plants are long gestation projects, Intel or for that matter any other semi-conductor manufacturer could face technology obsolesce risk, if these long gestation projects are further delayed. Technology changes very very rapidly in the semiconductor industry. Intel's options are getting narrower with time running out since a lot of taxpayer funded government money brought in through the CHIPS act is at risk and which came with a lot of strings tied to those grants.

name: Anish Nanda
position: Global Macro Economic Expert, Leadership roles in IT Organizations, Visionary Leader, Keynote Speaker on Global Financial Markets at various forums. Global Market Strategist, Forecasts Global Economic Trends
text: ğ‘ªğ’“ğ’šğ’‘ğ’•ğ’ ğ’„ğ’‰ğ’‚ğ’ğ’”: ğ‘¾ğ’‚ğ’›ğ’Šğ’“ğ‘¿ ğ’‰ğ’‚ğ’„ğ’Œ ğ’ğ’†ğ’‚ğ’—ğ’†ğ’” ğ’Šğ’ğ’—ğ’†ğ’”ğ’•ğ’ğ’“ğ’” ğ’Šğ’ ğ’‡ğ’Šğ’ğ’‚ğ’ğ’„ğ’Šğ’‚ğ’ ğ’•ğ’–ğ’“ğ’ğ’ğ’Šğ’ ğŸ”´   The automobile spare parts dealer in Patna got worried when he glanced at the alerts on his phone on July 18. News portals were reporting that Indiaâ€™s had been hacked. At first, he thought that meant a â€œtechnical glitchâ€ and things would get back to normal. The full extent of his misfortune was yet to be revealed.  â€œMy cousin told me some Rs 2,000 crore had been stolen from the company,â€ said the 32-year-old man. â€œI immediately rushed to withdraw my Rs 7 lakh investment on WazirX but it was too late--no transactions were allowed.â€  The prospect of never being able to get his money back has caused sleeplessness, anxiety, emotional distress and setbacks in business. At home, he pretends nothing has happened. â€œMy wife thinks I do some stock market trade,â€ he said. â€œShe doesnâ€™t understand crypto stuff--she thinks we are rich.â€  He dwells on what might have been.  â€œEvery day, I take a pen and paper (to calculate) and tell my co-worker that today the value of my crypto would have been Rs 25 lakh,â€ he said. â€œ(Auto) agency guys would have given us so much business on such credit.â€  About 15 million users of WazirX were victims of one of the largest cyberattacks on a cryptocurrency exchange in July, leading to the theft of investor holdings worth $235 million or nearly half of the platform's estimated reserves. Since then, the remaining funds on the platform have been frozen and trading has been halted.  Somewhere the thief (or thieves) who masterminded this heist is watching the tokens swell in value in the ongoing crypto bull run. As per an analysis of Lookonchain data, that $235 million will now be valued at about $330 million.  Crypto prices have skyrocketed in the past month following the victory of Donald Trumpâ€”a sceptic-turned-championâ€”in the US elections. In the past month, crypto market cap has grown from $2.4 trillion to $3.7 trillion, surpassing that of companies like Apple and Nvidia.  Netherlands-based blockchain intelligence firm Crystal Intelligence recently said that the WazirX thief has almost finished laundering the stolen funds via TornadoCash. Only $6 million of Ether (ETH) remains traceable. TornadoCash is an open source, non-custodial, fully decentralised cryptocurrency platform that shuffles crypto tokens, making it difficult to track the source of funds and recover any stolen money.

After the Corona disaster, graphics requirements increased due to web conferencing, online training, video playback, and the latest Office software, and the CPU load also increased. In 2022, the company added more servers and distributed virtual machines, but the situation did not improve and business efficiency remained low.  Since VDI did not provide satisfactory performance, the company was considering quitting VDI and migrating to physical PCs.  However, since data would remain on the physical PCs, the level of security was reduced and concerns remained.  <JSOL comment> We received a proposal to only enhance vCPUs from 2 vCPUs to 4 vCPUs, but we were worried. We received a proposal from another vendor to use NVIDIA's virtual GPU, saying, 'It would be better to enhance graphics performance without doubling the CPU,' which solved the problem. We received a proposal that we could 'increase the capacity ratio of virtual machines and reduce the number of servers' and 'improve performance by reducing CPU load while keeping costs down,' and we implemented the system after conducting actual testing.  Please check the details for customer testimonials.      .

As Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh said: â€œWe aim to not only conquer AI but also turn the sun, the wind, and the waves into clean energy for the future.â€ 4ï¸âƒ£ Skilled development: Vietnam is actively building a strong pipeline of skilled tech talent, investing heavily in education and upskilling to meet the demands of the semiconductor and AI industries.  NVIDIA recognizes this opportunity. And theyâ€™re not alone. , , , and now NVIDIA â€” some of the worldâ€™s biggest players are placing their trust in Vietnam.  ğŸ“Œ But to me, the most significant reason lies in the . name: Barney Geerligs
text: cont'd 2 of 2 The data pyramid is one of three key principles underpinning work on GR00T.  Moravecs paradox states that machines struggle to perform at things humans find easy.  Team GR00T believes training data is the key to overcoming Moravec. However, the  exabytes of text and video data available to existing models, while  useful base  information, is inadequate for robots to learn proprioception and motor skills.  The pyramid needs to be built out with real robot training data â€“ high value but limited due to time constraints and supplemented with more copious robot simulation data.  Here NVIDIA has been able to utilise clever tools and its titanic compute resource to simulate massive amounts of data in an environment called Omniverse. The importance of simulation is the backbone of the second â€œMatrix principleâ€. Generative AI  can create a multiplier effect from a few human based examples to thousands of virtual actions and in different environments, like climbing a flight of stairs.  Agents can then optimise this data in two learning paradigms. Reinforcement learning is an effective method for learning those intuitive motor actions we donâ€™t even think about, rebalancing after a stumble, for example. Those thousands of simulations can also be used in imitation learning, to best mimic human manipulation of various objects and tasks, such as making a cup of coffee. The final core principle is the foundation agent â€“ the idea that one neural network can be used for all humanoid robots, despite physical design differences, for all tasks. Again, mass simulation is what enables putting this principle into practice.   Interestingly the project team found GPT highly proficient at creating and optimising  Python code reward functions for the agent, including very complex actions such as spinning a pen through the fingers of one hand.  Tens of thousands of simulations of an action may not exactly represent the real world, but if generalisation holds the model will be able to learn the nth + 1 simulation in the real world.

name: Barney Geerligs
text: 1 of 2 Agents and models - weâ€™re not talking Bond movies here, rather agentic applications using large language models (LLMs). In tandem, these two hot topics offer us all the pinky promise and furrowed-brow worry of increasing automation and autonomous decision making, based primarily on natural language prompting. If you are curious about this burgeoning area, I can thoroughly recommend the free  LLM and Agents course currently offered by UC Berkeley RDI. Things I really like about the course (apart from being a freebie) Â·       An â€œAI A-listâ€ of weekly guest speakers kindly sharing their knowledge and practical experience and insights into the sprawling and rapidly developing field of agentic AI Â·       Optionality around participation â€“ pop in to a recorded guest lecture or go for full ninja certification by completing quizzes, labs and hackathon. Â·       Engaging content, including fun real-world labs that require a basic level of Python understanding. Now, in the interests of full disclosure, one of the course requirements is to summarise and post one of the guest speakerâ€™s lectures. Iâ€™ll go with Jim Fanâ€™s fascinating presentation of his teamâ€™s work into robotics at NVIDIA. The moonshot ambition is to build a foundational model (cutely named GR00T)  for humanoid robots, creating an embodied AI brain enabling robots to perceive, react and perform actions as we do. The scale of the challenge is immense, dwarfing the size and complexity of LLMs, such as ChatGPT. Why make robots in our own image, when specialised robots may perform specific tasks better? One aspect is social, we feel more comfortable in the presence of machines like us.  Another reason is practical, our built environments are purposed for our human form, so humanoid robots will fit in well.  Of course, money is a key motivator too, the economic opportunity of a humanoid workforce is revolutionary.  The risk of ensuing  mass unemployment is a definite worry point for us biological humans, although, breezily,  Jim Fan skips this threat. GR00T aims to be a â€œspecialised generalistâ€ â€“ providing the foundation for humanoid robots to become domain experts. Jim Fan draws the analogy of an LLM becoming special purpose (in coding, for example) after prompting, distillation and finetuning.  He maintains that history is on the side of the specialised generalist, being in the long run, cheaper and easier to maintain than an array of specialist applications, each with their own production pipeline.

E aproveitei para assistir um jogo de hÃ³quei, pela primeira vez na vida, torcendo para o Carolina Hurricanes dentro do Lenovo Center, a arena de Raleigh.  Voltando de US, direto do aeroporto para nosso evento com a DreamWorks, nosso cliente de muitos anos, para falar de como a Lenovo apoia a DreamWorks na criaÃ§Ã£o de suas animaÃ§Ãµes espetaculares!
